Summary: I paid $400 to stay two nights and it was awful. Rude and told me they will call the cops, for what he never told me...I stayed in the jacuzzi suite, paid cash and then on the second day booted me out for nothing...intimidation for having a couple of guests over...wtf. this place should be condemned!!!

Summary Heading: When people say don’t come to this place- literally don’t stay here
Summary: This place is terrible. To be specific with the main office. My friend and I checked in there and the lady at the main guest said specifically no visitors. There was no warning on the site where we booked this motel. We tried getting a refund, but she said that wasn’t possible. We had friends in town and had already asked if they could meet us there ASAP so we can go out for the night. As our 2 other friends were helping us move our stuff in the motel room (we were 2nd floor, stairs only- a lot to carry) the lady went up to us as we were in my car and asked us why we had 2 ppl more ppl staying at the room we were at. I felt extremely uncomfortable because she started questioning us as we were just settling in. Our other 2 friends were only helping us move our things upstairs. I

Summary Heading: Modest Price for Above Average Quality
Summary: I've stayed here a few times this last year and the quality is actually quite high compared to what I've witnessed at other hotels in the area.  I'll grant it's no 5-Star resort, but if you're looking for a place to spend a night rather than driving 20-hours, this is a good location.  Also, the staff are quite committed to your safety (and sense of safety).  Another guest started throwing a party and their 'guests' were knocking on other doors.  The staff had them removed immediately after it was reported (literally minutes).  So they earned this 4-star review. Take the negative reviews with a grain of salt.  I'll grant they were made by the people who were kicked out.

Summary Heading: Filthy, Dirty, The WiFi didn't work
Summary: First the clerk was innattentive, even though were were the only ones around.  Check-in took triple regular time.  Then the door lock was substandard, so I stacked chairs and suitcases to block the door while I slept.  Everthing was so old it was threadbare.  I swear they got the furniture from Salvation Army.  The carpet was 30 years old.  The mattress was 20 years old, and perfect contour if you are a banana.  Not so good for humans though.  No blankets, and sheets you can see through.  The bathrooms have not seen clorox in quite a while.  The shower curtain was 10 years old at least.  The showerhead was encrusted in old calcium deposits.  The curtain rod was rusty.  Only 2 towels, minimum size that cant fit all the way around your waist.  Get up nice and early because the lot
Room tip: The ground floor does not seem safe.

Summary: Not only is this the dirtiest place I have ever stayed at, but the staff is extremely rude to say the least. We came back from Disney at 11 pm to find our room key had been cancelled all because our friend met us there in the morning. We were told if we had another guest over we would be kicked out (even though they knew it was our last night). The "free" wifi doesn't work. We found a spider in our bathroom and a beetle came crawling out from under our bed. The rooms do NOT look like the pictures and building is extremely old.  Overall rudest employees I have ever encountered and dirtiest place we have ever stayed at!!

my fiancé and I booked a room at this hotel for our trip to Disneyland. when we walked in to our room, you can immediately feel the dust from the floor and walls. To top it all off, we found a meth pipe under our bed. When i told the front desk that we were not staying there because of the filth and meth pipe, she implied that i must have placed it there because "many people have stayed there before me" even after i showed her the picture. she also stated that i would still be charged for 1 night.

Summary Heading: Just needed a place to land
Summary: I found this by driving down Tustin Blvd.  Very simple, clean, no blanket for bed.  Cold water on arrival. No aaa discount avail. I might return if I was alone Not with my spouse . The wifi only worked in the office. The bed was acceptable. Refer and microwave. Owners were very nice. 99.00 covers s one night.

Summary Heading: operators not logical or informative,or helpful
Summary: adequate,not informative staff, there was not anything special that staff did or about the rooms. there was a large amount of dust and debris at the edges of the room and towels in restroom had torn and freyed edges.

Stayed there several times. Very satisfied every time. Frendly staff, and well equipped , clean rooms. I will recommend this motel for every one who are going to L A I am sure you will enjoy the stay.

This motel is old, not well maintained, and near a very busy street.  I had a reservation and once I got there I didn't feel safe and asked for a refund.  The manager was not helpful would not give it to me.  Not a great way to run a business.

We have kids at Chapman University and have stayed in many motels/hotels around the area over the last few years.  This hotel has been the BEST value!  We had a huge room, updated and very clean and quiet.  The bed was very comfortable.  Large TV and sofa bed including an iron and ironing table.  By far the best value for the money.  Also very conveniently located on Tustin Ave about a mile from campus and close to lots of shopping/stores.  We will be staying here from now on when visiting out kids!

Was it the cigarette burns in the plastic soap dish, or the stains on the mini fridge handle? Was it the threadbare sofa & chair, or the ill-fitting sheets?  The missing smoke detector?  The utility holes in the walls?  The broken window screen? The naked light bulbs? Or maybe it was the way the maid "sort of made" the bed.

Summary Heading: nice hotel, clean, recommend for those on a budget
Summary: I just recently stayed here. I have booked this many times, as they have great prices and the rooms are clean and nice. great  TV and cable, clean rooms, nice shower. if you want a place in the OC  for under $80, this is your place. perfect for those travelling , right off the 55 hwy and Chapman on Tustin Ave. just a nice clean motel

Summary Heading: Just what I was looking for....
Summary: A very nice place to stay.  It is very reasonably priced, clean and comfortable.  I stayed for 5 nights while in town for work.  The location is great.  Not right on the highway but within a mile or so of 22 and 2-3 miles of 55.   I had a newly remodeled room that featured hardwood floors and nice new tile bathroom.  Free and quick wifi. Room was complete with ironing board/iron and full size lounger, fridge and microwave I really didn't need for anything else.  Construction on an addition is progressing (got pretty far during my stay) and is nearly complete.  Close to very good Italian restaurant (Genovese Restorante) and Arthurs for breakfast.  Both less than a block away.  Peter the manager is very attentive (not pushy though) and made me feel that my stay was important to

I will say 2 star hotel the room is clean friendly service make you feel like your home. Recammend this place best value. 10 min form Disneyland a lot of place to eat around. I will return back in the is place

The Sky Palm doesn't try to be something it isn't.  It's a basic motel, nothing more.  It's clean and comfortable.  The people who run the place are extremely friendly and pleasant.  As noted by others, you get two bottles of cold water or soda when you check in, welcome on a hot day.  One unusual thing--it's an outdoor motel, but kind of ethereal music is piped throughout the parking lot.  The surroundings seemed reasonably safe, but be forewarned--there are no electronic locks on the doors, just good old fashioned keys.  And the room had a bit of a musty smell to it, especially with the A/C on--one call to the desk produced a can of Lysol to spray around which helped immensely.

I´ve been for three days at L.A. with four friends. We didn´t have so much money so we looked for a quite cheap motel. I asked for a smoker bedroom. When i came in it was like nightmare at elm´s street. Nothing seemed like the photos hanged in the web. Restaurant ? Swimming pool ? Where ?? The room was pretty old and the bathroom was rusty. Never more.

The desk man  was helpful,service wa awesome  I got to my room,the door was wide open,didnt hqave to mess with the key.It was hot that day and the man at the desk  offered me  two bottles of cold water.A great and relaxing stay,will returnagain next month.

Summary Heading: Good value, handy for many attractions
Summary: This is a good value, friendly, traditional motel well located on one of the main streets of Orange, run by Prakash Mistry and family.  The king size beds are very comfortable.and superior rooms with jacuzzis are available.  Just across the street is a Fresh and Easy grocery store for everything you might need.  Two of the best things about this motel are the Genovese family restaurant next door (highly recommended) and Arthur's coffee house next again, serving 'the greatest breakfasts in town' (also highly recommended).

Summary Heading: Great hideaway place, clean with nice rooms
Summary: This motel is a great value for the money. it looks like an 1960's motel on the outside, but they really fixed up the rooms and they are very clean and spacious. The TV is a large flat screen with direct TV and over 400 channels including HBO, SHOWtime, etc, at no extra charge. the  beds are king size, and i have stayed there 2 times already. if you want quiet and an out of the way place, this is for you. I really liked it
I don't know why this motel is listed as a B&B. It is a 2 story, outdated standard place to lay your head down. I put family there when we run out of room at our house, unless I love them.
